titleInfo.title: Letter No. 62 of 1854 from Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary to the Government, Secret Department, Bombay to Arnold Burrowes Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, at Bushire

mods.abstract: The letter is instructing the Resident that in the event that Persia declares war on Turkey, the steamer Akbar —currently at Bushire — should be ordered to immediately return to Bombay. It further conveys the approval of the Bombay Government over the Resident's decision to send the steamer Aucklandto Bussorah [Basra], and to delay its return to India until dispatches have been received from Tehran. It also notes that if possible the Akbarshould retrieve the antiquities collected by Lieutenant Colonel Rawlinson, the Political Agent in Turkish Arabia
